melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

translation.text: The Lord of the Breath of Life, the Merciful Primal Lord God, is my Friend.

melody.description: Kalian has a forceful, yet flexible nature. It conveys a desire for something and a resolve to attain it, by whatever means possible. Although determined in its desire, Kalian sometimes uses an accommodating approach and at other times has an aggressive approach, in order to reach its goal. This Raag has a determined, forceful, yet persuasive character, through which it fulfils its desire.

author.author: Guru Arjan Dev
author.description:
Guru Arjan Dev [1563 - 1606] was the fifth Guru of the Sikhs, born at Goindval. He was the youngest of the three sons of Guru Ram Das, the fourth Sikh Guru.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

text: ਗਰਭ ਜੋਨਿ ਕਲਿ ਕਾਲ ਜਾਲ ਦੁਖ ਬਿਨਾਸਨੁ ਹਰਿ ਰਖੇ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥

translation.text: The Lord saves us from the womb of reincarnation and the noose of death in this Dark Age of Kali Yuga; He takes away our pain. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: garabh jōn kal kāl jāl dukh bināsan har rakhē .1. rahāu .

melody.description: Kalian has a forceful, yet flexible nature. It conveys a desire for something and a resolve to attain it, by whatever means possible. Although determined in its desire, Kalian sometimes uses an accommodating approach and at other times has an aggressive approach, in order to reach its goal. This Raag has a determined, forceful, yet persuasive character, through which it fulfils its desire.

translation.text: I enshrine the Naam, the Name of the Lord, within; I seek Your Sanctuary, Lord.

translation.text: O Merciful Lord God, You are my only Support. ||1||

melody.description: Kalian has a forceful, yet flexible nature. It conveys a desire for something and a resolve to attain it, by whatever means possible. translation.text: You are the only Hope of the helpless, the meek and the poor.

translation.text: Your Name, O my Lord and Master, is the Mantra of the mind. ||2||

text: ਤੁਝ ਬਿਨਾ ਪ੍ਰਭ ਕਿਛੂ ਨ ਜਾਨੂ ॥

translation.text: I know of nothing except You, God.

transliteration.text: tujh binā prabh kishū n jānū .

translation.text: Throughout all the ages, I realize You. ||3||

translation.text: O Lord, You dwell in my mind night and day.

translation.text: The Lord of the Universe is Nanak's only Support. ||4||4||7||
